Sentencas: A novel method for fabricating Ni(NO3)(2) solution impregnated YSZ (YSZ: Yttria Stabilized Zirconia) anodes for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) is presented.
Titulo: A rapid preparation of acicular Ni impregnated anode with enhanced conductivity and operational stability

Sentencas: In order to reduce the impregnation cycles and increase the reliability of the YSZ membrane, a YSZ support with a porosity of similar to 60% is soaked in a saturated Ni(NO3)(2) solution with an increased temperature of 80 degrees C.
Titulo: A rapid preparation of acicular Ni impregnated anode with enhanced conductivity and operational stability

Sentencas: The impregnated anode is dried in a vacuum drying device without heating, resulting in a flower-like Ni(NO3)(2)center dot 6H(2)O crystal.
Titulo: A rapid preparation of acicular Ni impregnated anode with enhanced conductivity and operational stability

Sentencas: The formed porous structure is likely to facilitate the impregnating process and considered to be the key to success of the impregnation process with saturated solution.
Titulo: A rapid preparation of acicular Ni impregnated anode with enhanced conductivity and operational stability

Sentencas: After heating at 700 degrees C, a novel needle-shaped NiO is presented, which exhibits some advantages including fast preparation, high connectivity, large specific surface area and high operational stability (i.e. high aggregation resistance).
Titulo: A rapid preparation of acicular Ni impregnated anode with enhanced conductivity and operational stability

Sentencas: For the purpose of comparison, Ni(NO3)(2) solution impregnated YSZ anodes prepared through the conventional impregnation process are also characterized under the same conditions.
Titulo: A rapid preparation of acicular Ni impregnated anode with enhanced conductivity and operational stability
